Event.name: Collaboration
Event.definition:
<def-root><fen>Partner_1</fen> and <fen>Partner_2</fen> or a group of <fen>Partners</fen> work together in some <fen>Undertaking</fen>. The <fen>Partners</fen> are taken to be of equal status even when expressed disjointly.
<ex> <fex name="Partner_1">CSTR</fex> <fex name="Manner">actively</fex> <t>collaborates</t> <fex name="Partner_2">with the Departments of Artificial Intelligence and Physics</fex>. </ex> <ex> <fex name="Partners">Tom and the American composer Steve Riche</fex> have <fex name="Time">recently</fex> <t>collaborated</t> <fex name="Undertaking">on a piece of elevator music</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Partner_1
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause.
<ex> <fex name="Partner_1">Smithers</fex> <t>collaborated</t> with Chief Wiggum </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Partner_2
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration.
<ex> Britain is <t>collaborating</t> <fex name="Partner_2">with France and West Germany</fex> in the development of anti-tank missiles</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Undertaking
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the <fen>Partners</fen> are collaborating.
<ex> The two artists <t>collaborated</t> <fex name="Undertaking">on a mosaic</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which <fen>Partner_1</fen> collaborates with <fen>Partner_2</fen> or in which the <fen>Partners</fen> collaborate.</def-root>

Arg.name: Partners
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
<ex> <fex name="Partners">Smithers and Chief Wiggum</fex> <t>collaborated</t> well </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Partners</fen> are engaged in their collaboration.
<ex><fex name="Time">Last year</fex> some of my colleagues collaborated in the design of a theme-park.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the collaboration occurs.
<ex> <fex name="Place">In New Braunfels</fex> Paul and John <t>collaborated</t> in the design of a new Guggenheim </ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the amount of time the <fen>Partners</fen> collaborate.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate to what extent the <fen>Partners</fen> are cooperating.
<ex>The French government <t>cooperated</t> <fex name="Degree">fully</fex> with the New Zealand police.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action taken by the <fen>Partners</fen> that lets them accomplish the collaboration.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: collaborate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: work jointly on an activity or project

lexUnit.name: partner.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: associate as partners

lexUnit.name: collaborator.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person whith whom someone works on a joint project

lexUnit.name: partner.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody who takes part in an undertaking with one or more other people

lexUnit.name: in cahoots.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: colluding or conspiring together secretly

lexUnit.name: conspire.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make secret plans jointly to commit an unlawful or harmful act

lexUnit.name: collaboration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of working together with someone

lexUnit.name: associate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a partner or companion in business or at work

lexUnit.name: confederate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an accomplice or fellow worker

lexUnit.name: conspiracy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of conspiring

lexUnit.name: collude.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come to a secret understanding; conspire

lexUnit.name: collusion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: secret or illegal cooperation in order to cheat or deceive others

lexUnit.name: team up.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: come together as a team to achieve a common goal

lexUnit.name: cooperate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: work jointly towards the same end.

lexUnit.name: cooperation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of cooperating.

lexUnit.name: affiliated.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: connected to an organization or entity.

lexUnit.name: in league.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be collaborating with another

lexUnit.name: jointly.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: done in collaboration or conjunction with another entity

lexUnit.name: work together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: endeavor to complete a task in a partnered relationship.

lexUnit.name: together.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: with the combined efforts of one another
